Hello Craig,

By default heritrix crawls only within the domains of the seeds, except 
for urls that are "transcluded" in pages on the seed domains. 
Transcluded urls include things like images, javascript and css that 
embedded in a page.

max-hops caps the total number of hops from seed. Links off of a seed 
are 1 hop, links from 1 hop pages are 2 hops, etc.

max-trans-hops caps the number of the transclusion hops in a row that 
will be followed. So if a page has a css stylesheet that imports another 
stylesheet that sets a background image, that image will only be 
captured if max-trans-hops is at least 3 (or if the url is scope for 
some other reason).

max-speculative hops is the number of speculative hops in a row that 
will be followed. Strings that are found in javascript that look like 
they could be urls are considered speculative hops, as well as a few 
other similar things.

max-path-depth yes is what you assumed.

So, none of these really have to do with scoping to one domain. That 
pretty much happens by default. But if you want to very strictly limit 
crawling to only the seed domains, you can set max-trans-hops to zero.

Noah
